In 2009, Alvarez received an honor from the [[March of Dimes]] at its annual breakfast.<ref>[http://www.earthtimes.org/articles/show/the-march-of-dimes-honors,1014252.shtml ''The March of Dimes Honors Tammy Duckworth, Anita Alvarez and Kwame Raoul at its Annual 'Faces of Our Success' Awards Breakfast in Chicago'' www.earthtimes.org Retrieved: 2010-04-08.]</ref>
In 2009, Alvarez received an honor from the [[March of Dimes]] at its annual breakfast.<ref>[http://www.earthtimes.org/articles/show/the-march-of-dimes-honors,1014252.shtml ''The March of Dimes Honors Tammy Duckworth, Anita Alvarez and Kwame Raoul at its Annual 'Faces of Our Success' Awards Breakfast in Chicago'' www.earthtimes.org Retrieved: 2010-04-08.]</ref>
  +   +   +
==Criticism==
  +
Alvarez has been intensely criticized by groups concerned with wrongful convictions. In 2011, the [[Innocence Project]] launched a petition criticizing her refusal to act on new DNA evidence that exonerates nine men convicted of rapes and homicides, five of whom remain incarcerated. <ref>[https://secure2.convio.net/ip/site/Advocacy?cmd=display&page=UserAction&id=223 ''Help Free Five Innocent Men'' https://secure2.convio.net/ip/site/Advocacy?cmd=display&page=UserAction&id=223 Retrieved: 2011-09-23.]</ref> <ref>[http://www.change.org/innocence_project ''http://www.change.org/innocence_project'' http://www.change.org/innocence_project Retrieved: 2011-09-23.]</ref>
==Early life==
==Early life==
Alvarez graduated from [[St. Paul - Our Lady of Vilna School]] in Chicago. She attended [[Loyola University Chicago]] as an undergraduate, and [[Chicago-Kent College of Law]] as a law student.<ref>[http://www.nationaljournal.com/img/pdfs/090508_Alvarezbio.pdf '' Anita Alvarez'' www.nationaljournal.com Retrieved: 2010-04-08.]</ref>
Alvarez graduated from [[St. Paul - Our Lady of Vilna School]] in Chicago. She attended [[Loyola University Chicago]] as an undergraduate, and [[Chicago-Kent College of Law]] as a law student.<ref>[http://www.nationaljournal.com/img/pdfs/090508_Alvarezbio.pdf '' Anita Alvarez'' www.nationaljournal.com Retrieved: 2010-04-08.]</ref>
â
With nearly 860 attorneys and 1,560 employees, the Cook County State's Attorney's Office is the second largest prosecutor's office in the nation, second only to Los Angeles County. The Assistant Stateâs Attorneys in the Office prosecute all misdemeanor and felony crimes committed in Cook County, one of the largest counties in the nation encompassing nearly 1,000 square miles. The Office has an annual operating budget of approximately $123 million for fiscal year 2011.
+
==Current Work==
â
+
Anita Alvarez is currently pursuing charges against Tiawanda Moore who is being charged with recording a police officer's inappropriate sexual advances towards her. According to the Huffington Post "When Chicago police answered a domestic disturbance call at the home of Tiawanda Moore and her boyfriend in July 2010, the officers separated the couple to question them individually. Moore was interviewed privately in her bedroom. According to Moore, the officer who questioned her then came on to her, groped her breast and slipped her his home phone number."<ref>{{cite web|title=Huffington Post|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/06/08/chicago-district-attorney-recording-bad-cops_n_872921.html?ref=fb&src=sp|work=Chicago State's Attorney Lets Bad Cops Slide, Prosecutes Citizens Who Record Them|accessdate=9 June 2011}}</ref> In Illinois it is against the law to record anyone, audio or visual, without his or her consent.
â
In addition to direct criminal prosecution, the Stateâs Attorneyâs Office files legal actions to enforce child support orders, protect consumers and the elderly from exploitation, and assist thousands of victims of domestic violence every year. The Office is divided into seven bureaus: Criminal Prosecutions, Juvenile Justice, Narcotics, Special Prosecutions, Civil Actions, Investigations and Administrative Services.
